intro: Ardisia crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. The plant belongs to the family Ericaceae and is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Ardisia crassifolia is also used in traditional medicine in some regions for its purported health benefits.
